alert.note: Alert for Red River (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 11 at 4:28PM CDT until May 11 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Louisiana and northeast Texas, including the following counties and parishes, in northwest Louisiana, Bossier, Caddo, De Soto and Red River. In northeast Texas, Panola and Shelby. * WHEN...Until 545 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 428 PM CDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in Logansport due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. Between 4 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mansfield, Stonewall, Logansport, Joaquin, South Mansfield, Keachi, Grand Cane, Longstreet, Stanley, Kingston, Reeds Store, Gloster, Carmel, Kickapoo, Frierson, Keat Chie, Caspiana, Grand Bayou, Mc Dade and Evelyn. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
